channel.title: Making my own interfaces
channel.description:
Hello, I am looking into coding interfaces client sided, I am tired of seeing these shitty send frames all over the place, I have a few questions tho,
1. I know that they are coded in RsInterface, I am there now, but I heard something about class 44 what would I do their?
2. How would I assign the clicking button for it to open my interface?
Thats all for now, thanks for the help :)

item.title: Making my own interfaces
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Ahh. I see, thank, I’m tinkering around with this client, adding my own custom buttons and such, and everything just fucks up as you go along lol. But I’m getting better, its not all that hard as long as you understand the methods.

Read full topic

item.title: Making my own interfaces
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

It’s: aClass44 = streamLoader; And it’s where you declare your interfaces.
For it to open, it could be in multiple files like Client.java, ClickingButtons.java, and ActionHandler.java, it just depends if you want it to open when you click an npc, a button, or if you login.

For ClickingButtons:

Get the button ID in your server cmd prompt, here’s an example:

case ####: c.getPA().showInterface(####); break;
You could use: c.getPA().walkableInterface(####); If you want it to show when you walk.

For ActionHandler:

For NPC:

case ####: c.getPA().showInterface(####); break;
For an object, it’s the same but just in a different method in ActionHandler.java
There’s firstClickNpc, secondClickNpc, and thirdClickNpc.
As well as firstClickObject, secondClickObject, thirdClickObject.

Read full topic
